locale.message: This plugin enables the assignment of the Uniform Resource Names to monographs, chapters, publication formats and files in OMP.
Please configure the URN plug-in to be able to manage and use URNs in OMP:
Please choose the objects URNs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Uniform Resource Names (URN) assigned:
The URN prefix is the fix, never changing part of the URN (e.g. "urn:nbn:de:0000-").
The URN prefix pattern must be in the form "urn:"<NID>":"<NSS>.
A URN suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same URN prefix assigned:

Use the pattern entered below to generate URN suffixes. Use %p for press initials, %m for the monograph id, %c for the chapter id, %f for the publication format id, %s for the file id and %x for "Custom Identifier".
For example, press%ppub%r would create the URN suffix "pressESPpub100".

%p.%m for monographs
%p.%m.c%c for chapters
%p.%m.%f for publication formats
%p.%m.%f.%s for files.
Enter an individual URN suffix for each published item. You'll find an additional URN input field on each item's meta-data page.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for monographs.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for chapters.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for publication formats.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for files.
The check number will be automatically calculated and added at the end, as the last digit of an URN.
The persistent identifier namespace usually needed for the registration (e.g. at the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek).

If you change your URN configuration, URNs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the URN configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing URNs so that the new settings will take effect with all existing objects.
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing URNs?
The URN cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The URN cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern.
What you see is a preview of the URN. Select the checkbox and save the form to assign the URN.
The URN is assigned to this {$pubObjectType}.
The given URN suffix is already in use for another published item. Please enter a unique URN suffix for each item.
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing URN?
